conclusion: To determine the time during which there is an induced current in the frame, we need to consider the motion of the frame through the magnetic field and the conditions under which an induced current occurs.
The frame is a square with side length \( l \). The magnetic field has a width \( d \). The frame moves with a constant speed \( v \). The condition given is \( l < d \).

premise: The frame is a square with side length \( l \). The magnetic field has a width \( d \). The frame moves with a constant speed \( v \). The condition given is \( l < d \).
conclusion: An induced current occurs when the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field. The frame will enter the magnetic field, move through it, and then exit.

premise: An induced current occurs when the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field.
conclusion: The frame starts entering the magnetic field when its left edge reaches the left boundary of the magnetic field. The frame will be fully inside the magnetic field when its right edge reaches the left boundary of the magnetic field. This happens when the frame has moved a distance \( l \).

premise: The frame will be fully inside the magnetic field when its right edge reaches the left boundary of the magnetic field. This happens when the frame has moved a distance \( l \).
conclusion: Time to enter the magnetic field: \( t_{\text{entry}} = \frac{l}{v} \).

premise: The frame starts exiting the magnetic field when its left edge reaches the right boundary of the magnetic field. The frame will be fully out of the magnetic field when its right edge reaches the right boundary of the magnetic field. This happens when the frame has moved a distance \( d \) from the left boundary.
conclusion: Time to exit the magnetic field: \( t_{\text{exit}} = \frac{d}{v} \).

premise: The total time during which the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field is the time from when the left edge enters until the right edge exits.
conclusion: Total time: \( t_{\text{total}} = t_{\text{exit}} - t_{\text{entry}} = \frac{d}{v} - \frac{l}{v} = \frac{d - l}{v} \).

premise: The total time during which the frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field is the time from when the left edge enters until the right edge exits.
conclusion: The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is \( \frac{d - l}{v} \).
